I then spoke this mantra:

I cultivated the perfection of forbearance and insight.
My mind was free from afflictions.
I observed all sentient beings as if they were my own children.
I shed blood, which then turned into milk.
When I was practicing giving everything in pursuit of enlightenment,
A brahmin came before me
And begged for my head. I gave him my head, and he tied my hair to a tree.
At that time, I gave rise to a mind of loving-kindness and compassion and did not become angry or resentful.
Contemplate the brahmins as if they were your own children.
Even your wives and concubines you give away. I do not seek the pleasures of the five desires, I do not seek the sovereignty of a king, I do not seek the wealth and nobility of the heavens.

And subdue all enemies, attaining the highest position.
In order to destroy them, I speak the great bright and powerful [mantra].
And am able to give rise to past practices of the conduct of enlightenment.
